meanings.definition: To move or position again at a different station.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the workers were restationing the fallen trees to clear the road.
meanings.sent2: The army was restationing its troops to strengthen the defense line.
meanings.sent3: The robots were restationing the misplaced tools with precision and speed.
meanings.sent4: She felt like restationing her thoughts to focus on the positive aspects of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The conductor was restationing the musicians for a better acoustical balance.

meanings.definition: The act of relocating or reassigning to a different station.
meanings.sent1: The restationing of the cargo was necessary due to the change in destination.
meanings.sent2: The restationing of employees caused some confusion in the office.
meanings.sent3: The restationing of the pets in the shelter led to new friendships among them.
meanings.sent4: The restationing of the books on the shelves made the library look more organized.
meanings.sent5: The restationing of the buses at the terminal improved the flow of passengers.
